trader.name: Trader Finding Potion
trader.desc: This vial contains a golden, shimmering liquid. Drinking it will cause the next purple square you visit to definitely contain a merchant.

trainer.name: Trainer Finding Potion
trainer.desc: This vial contains a chalky-looking tan liquid. Drinking it will cause the next purple square you visit to definitely contain a skill trainer.

health_potion.name: Health Potion
health_potion.desc: A flask filled with a refreshing draught that can re-invigorate and rejuvenate even the most badly wounded fish. Restores half your max HP. May be used during combat.

cooldown_potion.name: Reset Cooldowns Potion
cooldown_potion.desc: This vial contains a fizzy, light-blue liquid. Drinking it will instantly refresh you, restoring 2 AP.

stat_potion.name: Mystery Potion
stat_potion.desc: A vial filled with a pearlescent, silver liquid. Drinking it will improve one of your stats at random.

biscuit_food.name: Fish Biscuits
biscuit_food.desc:
Restores all HP when consumed. Fish Biscuits are small, compact wafers made of delicious wild berries, soy protein, bacon fat, and high fructose corn syrup. "Fish Biscuits: They're what fish crave!"
Cook thoroughly before eating. Do not consume while pregnant. Consult your doctor before use. Fish Biscuits cannot be used as a tourniquet, or during combat.

reset_stone.name: Level Reset Stone
reset_stone.desc: A stone imbued with magical energies. It has the power to re-randomize the current dungeon level, letting you experience a brand new set of events, search for new treasures, and fight new monsters.

health_potion.name: Health Potion
health_potion.desc: A flask filled with a refreshing draught that can re-invigorate and rejuvenate even the most badly wounded fish. Restores up to half your max HP. May be used during combat.

gold.name: Gold Pieces (GP)
gold.desc: Shiny gold pieces, worth a pretty penny. Actually, worth several thousand pretty pennies. Don't spend it all in one place.

junk.name: Miscellaneous Junk
junk.desc: Discarded items that are of no discernible use to anyone.

weapon_scraps.name: Weapon Scraps
weapon_scraps.desc: Scraps of leather, iron, steel. Formerly part of someone's weapon. Maybe you could use it to make your own weapons better...

armor_scraps.name: Armor Scraps
armor_scraps.desc: Scraps of leather, iron, scales, or cloth. Formerly part of someone's adventuring gear. Maybe you could use it to reinforce your own armor somehow...

shiv.name: Shiv (1H)
shiv.desc: A sharpened piece of fish bone. Clearly whoever made this was significantly luckier than whomever it came from.

dagger.name: Dagger (1H)
dagger.desc: A shiny dagger. You could fillet someone with this. Careful not to cut yourself on the blade.

short_sword.name: Short Sword (1H)
short_sword.desc: It's like a dagger, but longer. STAB ALL THE THINGS.

greatsword.name: Greatsword (2H)
greatsword.desc: A very large sword. Requires great strength, and both fins to wield. Notoriously difficult to remove when lodged in stones.

misericorde.name: Misericorde (1H)
misericorde.desc: A knife with a long, narrow blade. Mainly used to slide between the gaps in armor. Stick them with the pointy end.

longsword.name: Longsword (2H)
longsword.desc: A two-finned weapon with a straight, 43-inch long, double-edged steel blade. Only a foot shorter than Peter Dinklage, and much deadlier. Although Peter is a much better actor, so there's that.

swordchucks.name: Swordchucks (2H)
swordchucks.desc: Nunchucks that someone has modified to feature swords on the ends. Truly a bizarre (yet effective) weapon. "Swordchucks, yo! I'd be like Bruce Lee meets Musashi! Only Better! God, I'm so BRILLIANT!"

bastard_sword.name: Bastard Sword (2H)
bastard_sword.desc: A sword that is midway in length between a short sword and a long sword. Little-known fact: the blade of this type of sword is honed in one of the harshest fashions known to fish-kind: Middle School.

claymore.name: Claymore (2H)
claymore.desc: A very large two-finned sword of Scottish origin. Requires great strength to wield, strength which can only come from someone who is tough enough to eat Haggis on a regular basis.

rapier.name: Rapier (1H)
rapier.desc: A slender, sharply pointed sword, best suited for thrusting attacks. Favored by officers and gentlemen alike.

naginata.name: Naginata (2H)
naginata.desc: A polearm which has a curved single-edged blade on the end. Originally used by the samurai class of feudal Japan. You look inarguably badass when you hold this.

gladius.name: Gladius (1H)
gladius.desc: The primary sword of Ancient Roman foot soldiers. Gladii are two-edged for cutting, and have a tapered point for stabbing during thrusting. See? It's a deadly weapon AND a history lesson.

cavalry_saber.name: Cavalry Saber (1H)
cavalry_saber.desc: Also spelled "sabre", but not to be confused with a Buick LeSabre. Sure, you don't want to be hit by either one, but only one of them can be wielded with a single hand. Unless you are The Incredible Hulk.

dirk.name: Dirk (1H)
dirk.desc: A long thrusting dagger. Historically it has been the personal weapon of naval officers. The fact that one is now in your possession suggests that at least one of those officers had slippery hands.

bowie_knife.name: Bowie Knife (1H)
bowie_knife.desc: This is apparently considered a type of "fighting knife". As opposed to what, a tickling knife? A putting knife? See also: "That's not a knife. Now THAT'S a knife."

kopis.name: Kopis (1H)
kopis.desc: An Ancient Greek word describing a heavy knife with a forward curving blade. That's it. I don't have anything else to say about this. Other than that it sounds really cool. Man, those Greeks had a lot of neat words for stuff, huh?

cleaver.name: Cleaver (1H)
cleaver.desc: A large knife that is largely used as a kitchen or butcher knife intended for hacking through bone. The knife's broad side can also be used for crushing in food preparation. See? It's a winner in combat AND in the kitchen!

kukri.name: Kukri (1H)
kukri.desc: A Nepalese knife with an inwardly curved blade, similar to a machete. Used as both a tool and as a weapon in Nepal. Bishnu Shrestha, a retired Indian Army Gurkha soldier, alone and armed only with a kukri, defeated 40 bandits who attacked a passenger train he was on in India. That probably speaks more to his bravery and his training than the kukri itself, I just wanted to include that tidbit because it is totally badass.

falchion.name: Falchion (1H)
falchion.desc: A large-bladed weapon of Medieval origin. Looks sort of like a machete with a hilt. Not to be confused with the Finnish heavy metal band of the same name. I'm not making that part up, Google it if you don't believe me!

cutlass.name: Cutlass (1H)
cutlass.desc: The favored weapon of both honest sailors and scurvy pirates. In accordance with International Maritime Law, Section 17, Subsection 8, Paragraph 92, you are required to yell "YARRRRR!" every time you swing this.

scimitar.name: Scimitar (1H)
scimitar.desc: A saber with a long curved blade. The name is thought to come from a Persian word which literally translates as "paw claw." I do NOT want to meet the animal that inspired that name.

falcata.name: Falcata (1H)
falcata.desc: The falcata was used to great effect by the armies of Carthage in their wars against Rome. The name seems to have been coined by Fernando Fulgosio in 1872. This superceded its earlier name of "Sharpey-Pokey-Ouchie"

flamberge.name: Flamberge (2H)
flamberge.desc: The name roughly means "flame-bladed", and has a characteristically undulating style of blade. It is not actually on fire. Which is good, because if you found a way to start a fire under water, you would make lots of physicists very cross with you.

acc_01.name: Necklace of %accessoryStat%
acc_01.desc: A fetching necklace that improves your %accessoryStat% by %accessoryStatAmt% when equipped.

tail_armor_01.name: Popsicle Stick Tail Armor
tail_armor_01.desc: Balsawood popsicle sticks, rubber-banded around your fin. It's not pretty, but it's something. +%armorValue% Armor when equipped

tail_armor_02.name: Molted Mermaid Tail
tail_armor_02.desc: The freshly molted tail of a mermaid. I bet you didn't even know they did that. Yeah, there's a lot of facts most people don't know about mermaids. Did you know that they're all named "Steve"? +%armorValue% Armor when equipped

tail_armor_03.name: Defective Jeans
tail_armor_03.desc: Someone made these jeans very incorrectly. Fortunately, they happen to fit you perfectly! +%armorValue% Armor when equipped

tail_armor_04.name: Barnacle Skirt
tail_armor_04.desc: Say what you will, is it any weirder than 'meat dress'? That's what I thought. +%armorValue% Armor when equipped

fin_armor_01.name: Chainmail Fin-Gloves
fin_armor_01.desc: Someone probably bought these off Etsy. +%armorValue% Armor when worn. You'll also probably get weird looks from people, but that's hard to quantify as easily.

fin_armor_02.name: Plushy Fin-Mitts
fin_armor_02.desc: Not very good at being armor, but great at being extremely comfortable. You could cuddle the whole world in these things! +%armorValue% Armor when equipped

body_armor_01.name: Discarded Soda Can Armor
body_armor_01.desc: A set of armor crudely fashioned from soda cans that someone threw in the river. Someone else's senseless litter is your gain! +%armorValue% Armor when worn. -1000 Style.

body_armor_02.name: Leather Armor
body_armor_02.desc: A set of leather body armor. Gives +%armorValue% Armor when worn. Gives 0 Armor when it's just sitting in your bag.

body_armor_03.name: Fish Bone Armor
body_armor_03.desc: A set of body armor fashioned out of fish bones. Macabre, but effective. +%armorValue% Armor when equipped.

head_armor_01.name: Tinfoil Hat
head_armor_01.desc: Candy bar and snack wrappers that someone fished (hah!) out of the garbage and fashioned into a hat. +%armorValue% Armor when worn. Also +10 at keeping the voices out.

head_armor_02.name: Leather Helm
head_armor_02.desc: A round helm made out of leather. With some difficulty, you can adapt it to the shape of your head. +%armorValue% Armor when worn.

shield_01.name: Bark Shield
shield_01.desc: A thick piece of bark scraped off the side of a sunken log. Not pretty, but at least it's something solid between you and those who mean you harm. %armorValue% Armor when equipped.

shield_02.name: Hide Shield
shield_02.desc: A deer hide wrapped around a frame of fish bones. You're not really sure how a deer got underwater, but you're grateful for the +%armorValue% Armor it provides when equipped.

trash_10.name: Star Wars Christmas Special on VHS

slashing: Thunderfury, Blessed Blade of the Finseeker
